item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 1:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Why wordfreq will not be updated (226 points | 54 comments)
2. Apple mobile processors are now made in America by TSMC (992 points | 425 comments)
3. Haxe lang – build cross-platform application with fast cross-compiler (86 points | 19 comments)
4. Scramble: Open-Source Alternative to Grammarly (281 points | 121 comments)
5. Independent directors of 23andMe resign from board (475 points | 242 comments)
6. React for R (65 points | 31 comments)
7. Atkinson Hyperlegible Font (596 points | 165 comments)
8. macOS Sequoia 15 may bypass DNS encryption (485 points | 158 comments)
9. Show HN: sol – A de-minifier for shell programs (86 points | 5 comments)
10. The Continued Trajectory of Idiocy in the Tech Industry (50 points | 32 comments)
11. Gentle Guide to Self-Hosting (34 points | 5 comments)
12. How Raw sockets behave differently in macOS and Linux (44 points | 7 comments)
13. U.S. overdose deaths plummet, saving thousands of lives (31 points | 13 comments)
14. Errors from `Close` (6 points | discuss)
15. GraalPy – A high-performance embeddable Python 3 runtime for Java (279 points | 122 comments)
16. Rga: Ripgrep, but also search in PDFs, E-Books, Office documents, zip, etc. (453 points | 49 comments)
17. Asgard launches world's first DDR5-9600 DIMMs (55 points | 27 comments)
18. John Peralta Explodes Historic Technology into Three-Dimensional Diagrams (74 points | 6 comments)
19. A Friendly Introduction to Assembly for High-Level Programmers (185 points | 26 comments)
20. Reports of the death of dental cavities are greatly exaggerated (140 points | 90 comments)
21. Show HN: Open Scanner, an open-source document scanning app for iPhone (227 points | 74 comments)
22. The Lego Great Ball Contraption (256 points | 41 comments)
23. Scrolling Text Display (67 points | 4 comments)
24. Why Gauss wanted a heptadecagon on his tombstone (275 points | 62 comments)
25. Emerge Tools (YC W21) is hiring a senior front end engineer ( | hide)
26. OpenTelemetry Tracing in < 200 lines of code (197 points | 24 comments)
27. Rustpad is an efficient and minimal open-source collaborative text editor (69 points | 10 comments)
28. NetWare NFS Gateway 1.1 (9 points | 3 comments)
29. Implement algorithms that minimize slippage (46 points | 5 comments)
30. Hezbollah pager explosions kill several people in Lebanon (926 points | 2096 comments)
